page.title: 13Farming
page.content: Altogether he keeps 8,000 chickens.2,000 in each shed.He only buys female chickens.He has a hopper in which he keeps the chickens' feed. It holds 7 tons of meal.This automatically goes onto a conveyor belt which moves round each shed so the chickens can feed easily.They are fed twice a day.They also have automatic water troughs.This method is called deep litter farming.The droppings which the chickens make are used on his farm as fertiliser. HALL FARM ,WALGRAVE Hall farm once belonged to the Langham Family who were the landowners in the area.It was sold in 1911 to the Knight family under whose ownership it still remains.Mr.R.Knight lives in a bungalow on the farm and his son ,Brian, and family live in Hall Farm.
